intro: Jacksonia intricata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteroideae subfamily and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and linear, sword-shaped leaves. The plant is often found in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its fibrous leaves were historically used by Māori for making clothing and fishing nets. Jacksonia intricata is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and conservation efforts.
